author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Salem region of the Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation (TNSTC) will operate about 60 special buses from different parts of the western districts to Madheswaran Hills in Karnataka in connection with the Mahasivarathri festival that falls on March 7.

The special buses will be operated round the clock from March 5 to 9.

A press release from the TNSTC here on Friday said that the special buses will be operated from Salem to Madheswaran Hills (via Mechri, Mettur); from Mettur to Madheswaran Hills (via Kolathur, Palar); Dharmapuri to Madheswaran Hills (via Mecheri, Mettur); Krishnagiri to Madheswaran Hills (Dharmapuri, Mettur); Hosur to Madhewaran Hills (via Krishnagiri, Dharmapuri) and Erode to Madheswaran Hills (via Bhavani and Mettur).
title: Special buses
